column5: Hope everyones having a great summer so far,Was wondering if anyone can recommend a good hotel or motel in the nakina longlac or geralton area for next year in June. Will be headed in a different direction so not familiar with the area. As long as its clean with a restaurant close by. Thanks, John

Pennocks in Nakina but be sure to book ahead, nice motel with rental houses for overnight use as well. No restaurant in Nakina but a fry truck just opened up with a good menu and she even does a breakfast on the run, hope she does well that town needs some kind of food service. In geraldton you have the crown & anchor which is both a motel and eatery, never stayed there but I have had breakfast which was good.
Between the Bridges Hotel in Geraldton is very clean and have a restaurant in the building and they really take care of you.

We have stayed at the Four Winds in Longlac several times and it is perfectly adequate for an overnight stopover. They have, as I recall, a typical hotel breakfast that is included. Or you can get donuts and some other breakfast items across the street at Robinâ€™s Donuts. We actually prefer the Crown and Anchor because it puts us a bit closer to Nakina and there is a pretty good little restaurant on site.

Stayed at the Four Winds in Longlac a few years ago. Decent clean hotel. There's a restaurant/pizza place across the parking lot. They have a downstairs bar where we had a good time with some of the locals. Pizza was pretty decent.
We are staying overnight at R&D apartments in Nakina. Will be our first time there, I will report on that when I get back.

We overnighted at Lower Twin Lakes Camp in June. I think $40 guy. It was nothing fancy but comfortable and relatively close to Nakina float plane base. Not much for eating establishments up that way. Good Luck
